title: Riot's ban system...
body:
i am currently banned for getting upset over being flamed sexual harassed and threatened in game. but hear me out... we won our game... i was being flamed for not playing the way our mid wanted me to. i was being told to swallow loads and that my gf was going to have his babies and all of this was okay as long as i got my ban? how can some of these players make sexist comments racist comments and continue to show up in these games but i am permabanned? and checking his history he is currently in another game so his behavior apparently was approved and all  was fine?

I am not justifying my actions i am just wondering why i can be told to swallow a load and he can continue to enjoy playing the game but if i call someone toxic and try and defend myself i get perma banned? can i Please get an answer that makes sense? why is sexual harassment okay but getting upset for it not?

Let's have you understand the behavioral system a bit more. Think of it like a health bar (or tension meter) in music games. When you hit the note at an off beat,  your tension meter  increases. When you completely miss a note, the meter increases by alot. When you hit the note at good timings, it reduces the meter. 

Riot's behavior system works the same way, as in we all have a toxicity meter attached to our accounts. When players are mildly toxic, it goes up a tad. When people use hate speech, it pretty much fills up the meter. of course, clean games reduce the meter. 

It is possible for playerA to get punished and playerB not to, even though playerB was waaayyyyy more toxic . Let's say playerA started the game with the toxicity meter at 95% and playerB's at 35%. Ingame, playerB said some pretty nasty shit and playerA responds with some shit as well. After the game, playerA gains 10% toxicity and playerB gains 50%. Now playerA is at 105% toxicity and gets punished, whereas playerB is at 85%, and not punished in that specific game, even though playerB was found to be 5x more toxic than playerA in that game. 

So for you to be permabanned,  I'd look at your behavior history and how you got there in the first place.

I'll try to explain it one last time in the most logical way I can.

Zero Tolerance is what nets immediate escalation to a 14 day punishment or perm from no punishment. What falls under Zero Tolerance is typically Hate Speech (which includes things such as Racism) and Encouraging self harm.

In this case, the comments mentioned would NOT fall under such. They are consider crude and should contribute to a punishment on their own. If you reported, the system would review and task however many ticks to their punishment. If you didn't report them, then their gameplay may not get reviewed unless someone else reported them. 

It is unlikely, in my opinion, to be automatically escalated without a manual review. Which, this is not the place to look for such.

Theres a lot of factors. Well maybe not a LOT. Its simple actually... you dont just get banned immediately every time you break a rule. Think of it like there is a toxicity meter attatched to your account. Everytime you break a rule, it goes up. If your offense was eggregious enough (like "hatespeech" and encouragements of suicide) it goes up a lot. So maybe their meter was low. Maybe they dont break the rules very often. Maybe all they got was a 10 game chat restrict because theyve never been punished. Maybe it got escalated to a 25 game chat restrict because Riot found it eggregious enough, or maybe he already had a 10 game CR.

If you are out in public, and you make one comment to someone, even if that comment is sexual, it is not sexual harassment. Sure, the OP could exaggerate and/or lie to get the cops involved - but the second the investigation took place the cops would let the person go.

It's not illegal nor is it sexual harassment to be crass or make a couple sexual comments in a public area.

You call the cops, you make a report. Insist that the cops take the report. That person will have it on record, and if they get more reports, they go to jail, because in many states, cat-calling on the streets is harassment.
